post.description:
Imports a CSV file into a product to propogate arbitrary meta and tags on endpoints.

By Names:
- Provide `product_name` of existing product

By ID:
- Provide the id of the product in the `product` parameter

In this scenario Defect Dojo will look up the product by the provided details.

post.description:
Imports a scan report into an engagement or product.

By ID:
- Create a Product (or use an existing product)
- Create an Engagement inside the product
- Provide the id of the engagement in the `engagement` parameter

In this scenario a new Test will be created inside the engagement.

By Names:
- Create a Product (or use an existing product)
- Create an Engagement inside the product
- Provide `product_name`
- Provide `engagement_name`
- Optionally provide `product_type_name`

In this scenario Defect Dojo will look up the Engagement by the provided details.

When using names you can let the importer automatically create Engagements, Products and Product_Types
by using `auto_create_context=True`.

When `auto_create_context` is set to `True` you can use `deduplication_on_engagement` to restrict deduplication for
imported Findings to the newly created Engagement.

post.description:
Reimports a scan report into an existing test.

By ID:
- Create a Product (or use an existing product)
- Create an Engagement inside the product
- Import a scan report and find the id of the Test
- Provide this in the `test` parameter

By Names:
- Create a Product (or use an existing product)
- Create an Engagement inside the product
- Import a report which will create a Test
- Provide `product_name`
- Provide `engagement_name`
- Optional: Provide `test_title`

In this scenario Defect Dojo will look up the Test by the provided details.
If no `test_title` is provided, the latest test inside the engagement will be chosen based on scan_type.

When using names you can let the importer automatically create Engagements, Products and Product_Types
by using `auto_create_context=True`.

When `auto_create_context` is set to `True` you can use `deduplication_on_engagement` to restrict deduplication for
imported Findings to the newly created Engagement.

title.description: A short description of the flaw.

date.description: The date the flaw was discovered.

sla_start_date.description: (readonly)The date used as start date for SLA calculation. Set by expiring risk acceptances. Empty by default, causing a fallback to 'date'.

cwe.description: The CWE number associated with this flaw.

cvssv3.title: CVSS v3
cvssv3.description: Common Vulnerability Scoring System version 3 (CVSSv3) score associated with this flaw.

cvssv3_score.description: Numerical CVSSv3 score for the vulnerability. If the vector is given, the score is updated while saving the finding

url.description: External reference that provides more information about this flaw.

severity.description: The severity level of this flaw (Critical, High, Medium, Low, Informational).

description.description: Longer more descriptive information about the flaw.

mitigation.description: Text describing how to best fix the flaw.

impact.description: Text describing the impact this flaw has on systems, products, enterprise, etc.

steps_to_reproduce.description: Text describing the steps that must be followed in order to reproduce the flaw / bug.

severity_justification.description: Text describing why a certain severity was associated with this flaw.

references.description: The external documentation available for this flaw.

active.description: Denotes if this flaw is active or not.

verified.description: Denotes if this flaw has been manually verified by the tester.

false_p.title: False Positive
false_p.description: Denotes if this flaw has been deemed a false positive by the tester.

duplicate.description: Denotes if this flaw is a duplicate of other flaws reported.

out_of_scope.description: Denotes if this flaw falls outside the scope of the test and/or engagement.

risk_accepted.description: Denotes if this finding has been marked as an accepted risk.

under_review.description: Denotes is this flaw is currently being reviewed.

last_status_update.description: Timestamp of latest status update (change in status related fields).

under_defect_review.description: Denotes if this finding is under defect review.

is_mitigated.description: Denotes if this flaw has been fixed.

mitigated.description: Denotes if this flaw has been fixed by storing the date it was fixed.

numerical_severity.description: The numerical representation of the severity (S0, S1, S2, S3, S4).

last_reviewed.description: Provides the date the flaw was last 'touched' by a tester.

param.title: Parameter
param.description: Parameter used to trigger the issue (DAST).

payload.description: Payload used to attack the service / application and trigger the bug / problem.

hash_code.description: A hash over a configurable set of fields that is used for findings deduplication.

line.title: Line number
line.description: Source line number of the attack vector.

component_name.description: Name of the affected component (library name, part of a system, ...).

static_finding.title: Static finding (SAST)
static_finding.description: Flaw has been detected from a Static Application Security Testing tool (SAST).

dynamic_finding.title: Dynamic finding (DAST)
dynamic_finding.description: Flaw has been detected from a Dynamic Application Security Testing tool (DAST).

created.description: The date the finding was created inside DefectDojo.

scanner_confidence.description: Confidence level of vulnerability which is supplied by the scanner.

unique_id_from_tool.description: Vulnerability technical id from the source tool. Allows to track unique vulnerabilities.

vuln_id_from_tool.title: Vulnerability ID from tool

sast_source_line.title: SAST Source Line number
sast_source_line.description: Source line number of the attack vector.

sast_source_file_path.description: Source file path of the attack vector.

nb_occurences.title: Number of occurences
nb_occurences.description: Number of occurences in the source tool when several vulnerabilites were found and aggregated by the scanner.

publish_date.description: Date when this vulnerability was made publicly available.

service.description: A service is a self-contained piece of functionality within a Product. This is an optional field which is used in deduplication of findings when set.

planned_remediation_date.description: The date the flaw is expected to be remediated.

review_requested_by.description: Documents who requested a review for this finding.

defect_review_requested_by.description: Documents who requested a defect review for this flaw.

sonarqube_issue.description: The SonarQube issue associated with this finding.

template_match.title: Template Match Enabled
template_match.description: Enables this template for matching remediation advice. Match will be applied to all active, verified findings by CWE.

template_match_title.title: Match Template by Title and CWE
template_match_title.description: Matches by title text (contains search) and CWE.

role.title: Global role
role.description: The global role will be applied to all product types and products.

configuration_name.description: Enter a name to give to this configuration

url.title: JIRA URL
url.description: For more information how to configure Jira, read the DefectDojo documentation.

default_issue_type.description: You can define extra issue types in settings.py

issue_template_dir.description: Choose the folder containing the Django templates used to render the JIRA issue description. These are stored in dojo/templates/issue-trackers. Leave empty to use the default jira_full templates.

epic_name_id.description: To obtain the 'Epic name id' visit https://<YOUR JIRA URL>/rest/api/2/field and search for Epic Name. Copy the number out of cf[number] and paste it here.

open_status_key.title: Reopen Transition ID
open_status_key.description: Transition ID to Re-Open JIRA issues, visit https://<YOUR JIRA URL>/rest/api/latest/issue/<ANY VALID ISSUE KEY>/transitions?expand=transitions.fields to find the ID for your JIRA instance

close_status_key.title: Close Transition ID
close_status_key.description: Transition ID to Close JIRA issues, visit https://<YOUR JIRA URL>/rest/api/latest/issue/<ANY VALID ISSUE KEY>/transitions?expand=transitions.fields to find the ID for your JIRA instance

info_mapping_severity.description: Maps to the 'Priority' field in Jira. For example: Info

low_mapping_severity.description: Maps to the 'Priority' field in Jira. For example: Low

medium_mapping_severity.description: Maps to the 'Priority' field in Jira. For example: Medium

high_mapping_severity.description: Maps to the 'Priority' field in Jira. For example: High

critical_mapping_severity.description: Maps to the 'Priority' field in Jira. For example: Critical

finding_text.description: Additional text that will be added to the finding in Jira. For example including how the finding was created or who to contact for more information.

accepted_mapping_resolution.description: JIRA resolution names (comma-separated values) that maps to an Accepted Finding

false_positive_mapping_resolution.description: JIRA resolution names (comma-separated values) that maps to a False Positive Finding

global_jira_sla_notification.title: Globally send SLA notifications as comment?
global_jira_sla_notification.description: This setting can be overidden at the Product level

jira_creation.description: The date a Jira issue was created from this finding.

jira_change.title: Jira last update
jira_change.description: The date the linked Jira issue was last modified.

issue_template_dir.description: Choose the folder containing the Django templates used to render the JIRA issue description. These are stored in dojo/templates/issue-trackers. Leave empty to use the default jira_full templates.

custom_fields.description: JIRA custom field JSON mapping of Id to value, e.g. {"customfield_10122": [{"name": "8.0.1"}]}

default_assignee.description: JIRA default assignee (name). If left blank then it defaults to whatever is configured in JIRA.

add_vulnerability_id_to_jira_label.title: Add vulnerability Id as a JIRA label

push_all_issues.description: Automatically maintain parity with JIRA. Always create and update JIRA tickets for findings in this Product.

risk_acceptance_expiration_notification.title: Send Risk Acceptance expiration notifications as comment?

location.description: Location of network testing: Examples: VPN, Internet or Internal.

user_records.description: Estimate the number of user records within the application.

external_audience.description: Specify if the application is used by people outside the organization.

internet_accessible.description: Specify if the application is accessible from the public internet.

enable_simple_risk_acceptance.description: Allows simple risk acceptance by checking/unchecking a checkbox.

enable_full_risk_acceptance.description: Allows full risk acceptance using a risk acceptance form, expiration date, uploaded proof, etc.

acronym.description: A shortened representation of the name.

jurisdiction.description: The territory over which the regulation applies.

reference.description: An external URL for more information.

name.title: Custom SLA Name
name.description: A unique name for the set of SLAs.

critical.title: Critical Finding SLA Days
critical.description: number of days to remediate a critical finding.

high.title: High Finding SLA Days
high.description: number of days to remediate a high finding.

medium.title: Medium Finding SLA Days
medium.description: number of days to remediate a medium finding.

low.title: Low Finding SLA Days
low.description: number of days to remediate a low finding.

enable_auditlog.title: Enable audit logging
enable_auditlog.description: With this setting turned on, Dojo maintains an audit log of changes made to entities (Findings, Tests, Engagements, Procuts, ...)If you run big import you may want to disable this because the way django-auditlog currently works, there's a big performance hit. Especially during (re-)imports.

enable_deduplication.title: Deduplicate findings
enable_deduplication.description: With this setting turned on, Dojo deduplicates findings by comparing endpoints, cwe fields, and titles. If two findings share a URL and have the same CWE or title, Dojo marks the less recent finding as a duplicate. When deduplication is enabled, a list of deduplicated findings is added to the engagement view.

delete_duplicates.description: Requires next setting: maximum number of duplicates to retain.

max_dupes.title: Max Duplicates
max_dupes.description: When enabled, if a single issue reaches the maximum number of duplicates, the oldest will be deleted. Duplicate will not be deleted when left empty. A value of 0 will remove all duplicates.

enable_jira_web_hook.description: Please note: It is strongly recommended to use a secret below and / or IP whitelist the JIRA server using a proxy such as Nginx.

disable_jira_webhook_secret.title: Disable web hook secret
disable_jira_webhook_secret.description: Allows incoming requests without a secret (discouraged legacy behaviour)

jira_webhook_secret.title: JIRA Webhook URL
jira_webhook_secret.description: Secret needed in URL for incoming JIRA Webhook

add_vulnerability_id_to_jira_label.title: Add vulnerability Id as a JIRA label

slack_channel.description: Optional. Needed if you want to send global notifications.

slack_token.description: Token required for interacting with Slack. Get one at https://api.slack.com/tokens

slack_username.description: Optional. Will take your bot name otherwise.

msteams_url.description: The full URL of the incoming webhook

false_positive_history.description: DefectDojo will automatically mark the finding as a false positive if the finding has been previously marked as a false positive. Not needed when using deduplication, advised to not combine these two.

url_prefix.description: URL prefix if DefectDojo is installed in it's own virtual subdirectory.

enable_product_grade.title: Enable Product Grading
enable_product_grade.description: Displays a grade letter next to a product to show the overall health.

enable_benchmark.title: Enable Benchmarks
enable_benchmark.description: Enables Benchmarks such as the OWASP ASVS (Application Security Verification Standard)

enable_template_match.title: Enable Remediation Advice
enable_template_match.description: Enables global remediation advice and matching on CWE and Title. The text will be replaced for mitigation, impact and references on a finding. Useful for providing consistent impact and remediation advice regardless of the scanner.

engagement_auto_close.title: Enable Engagement Auto-Close
engagement_auto_close.description: Closes an engagement after 3 days (default) past due date including last update.

engagement_auto_close_days.description: Closes an engagement after the specified number of days past due date including last update.

enable_finding_sla.title: Enable Finding SLA's
enable_finding_sla.description: Enables Finding SLA's for time to remediate.

enable_notify_sla_active.title: Enable Notifiy SLA's Breach for active Findings
enable_notify_sla_active.description: Enables Notify when time to remediate according to Finding SLA's is breached for active Findings.

enable_notify_sla_active_verified.title: Enable Notifiy SLA's Breach for active, verified Findings
enable_notify_sla_active_verified.description: Enables Notify when time to remediate according to Finding SLA's is breached for active, verified Findings.

enable_notify_sla_jira_only.title: Enable Notifiy SLA's Breach for Findings linked to JIRA
enable_notify_sla_jira_only.description: Enables Notify when time to remediate according to Finding SLA's is breached for Findings that are linked to JIRA issues.

allow_anonymous_survey_repsonse.title: Allow Anonymous Survey Responses
allow_anonymous_survey_repsonse.description: Enable anyone with a link to the survey to answer a survey

disclaimer.title: Custom Disclaimer
disclaimer.description: Include this custom disclaimer on all notifications and generated reports

risk_acceptance_form_default_days.description: Default expiry period for risk acceptance form.

risk_acceptance_notify_before_expiration.title: Risk acceptance expiration heads up days
risk_acceptance_notify_before_expiration.description: Notify X days before risk acceptance expires. Leave empty to disable.

enable_calendar.description: With this setting turned off, the Calendar will be disabled in the user interface.

default_group_email_pattern.description: New users will only be assigned to the default group, when their email address matches this regex pattern. This is optional condition.

minimum_password_length.description: Requires user to set passwords greater than minimum length.

maximum_password_length.description: Requires user to set passwords less than maximum length.

uppercase_character_required.description: Requires user passwords to contain at least one uppercase letter (A-Z).

slack_token.description: Token required for interacting with Slack. Get one at https://api.slack.com/tokens

slack_username.description: Optional. Will take your bot name otherwise.

msteams_url.description: The full URL of the incoming webhook

false_positive_history.description: DefectDojo will automatically mark the finding as a false positive if the finding has been previously marked as a false positive. Not needed when using deduplication, advised to not combine these two.

url_prefix.description: URL prefix if DefectDojo is installed in it's own virtual subdirectory.

enable_product_grade.title: Enable Product Grading
enable_product_grade.description: Displays a grade letter next to a product to show the overall health.

enable_benchmark.title: Enable Benchmarks
enable_benchmark.description: Enables Benchmarks such as the OWASP ASVS (Application Security Verification Standard)

enable_template_match.title: Enable Remediation Advice
enable_template_match.description: Enables global remediation advice and matching on CWE and Title. The text will be replaced for mitigation, impact and references on a finding. Useful for providing consistent impact and remediation advice regardless of the scanner.

engagement_auto_close.title: Enable Engagement Auto-Close
engagement_auto_close.description: Closes an engagement after 3 days (default) past due date including last update.

engagement_auto_close_days.description: Closes an engagement after the specified number of days past due date including last update.

enable_finding_sla.title: Enable Finding SLA's
enable_finding_sla.description: Enables Finding SLA's for time to remediate.

enable_notify_sla_active.title: Enable Notifiy SLA's Breach for active Findings
enable_notify_sla_active.description: Enables Notify when time to remediate according to Finding SLA's is breached for active Findings.

enable_notify_sla_active_verified.title: Enable Notifiy SLA's Breach for active, verified Findings
enable_notify_sla_active_verified.description: Enables Notify when time to remediate according to Finding SLA's is breached for active, verified Findings.

enable_notify_sla_jira_only.title: Enable Notifiy SLA's Breach for Findings linked to JIRA
enable_notify_sla_jira_only.description: Enables Notify when time to remediate according to Finding SLA's is breached for Findings that are linked to JIRA issues.

allow_anonymous_survey_repsonse.title: Allow Anonymous Survey Responses
allow_anonymous_survey_repsonse.description: Enable anyone with a link to the survey to answer a survey

disclaimer.title: Custom Disclaimer
disclaimer.description: Include this custom disclaimer on all notifications and generated reports

risk_acceptance_form_default_days.description: Default expiry period for risk acceptance form.

risk_acceptance_notify_before_expiration.title: Risk acceptance expiration heads up days
risk_acceptance_notify_before_expiration.description: Notify X days before risk acceptance expires. Leave empty to disable.

enable_credentials.description: With this setting turned off, credentials will be disabled in the user interface.

enable_questionnaires.description: With this setting turned off, questionnaires will be disabled in the user interface.

enable_checklists.description: With this setting turned off, checklists will be disabled in the user interface.

enable_endpoint_metadata_import.description: With this setting turned off, endpoint metadata import will be disabled in the user interface.

enable_google_sheets.title: Enable Google Sheets Integration
enable_google_sheets.description: With this setting turned off, the Google sheets integration will be disabled in the user interface.

enable_rules_framework.description: With this setting turned off, the rules framwork will be disabled in the user interface.

enable_user_profile_editable.title: Enable user profile for writing
enable_user_profile_editable.description: When turned on users can edit their profiles

enable_product_tracking_files.description: With this setting turned off, the product tracking files will be disabled in the user interface.

enable_finding_groups.description: With this setting turned off, the Finding Groups will be disabled.

enable_calendar.description: With this setting turned off, the Calendar will be disabled in the user interface.

default_group_email_pattern.description: New users will only be assigned to the default group, when their email address matches this regex pattern. This is optional condition.

minimum_password_length.description: Requires user to set passwords greater than minimum length.

maximum_password_length.description: Requires user to set passwords less than maximum length.

number_character_required.title: Password must contain one digit
number_character_required.description: Requires user passwords to contain at least one digit (0-9).

special_character_required.title: Password must contain one special character
special_character_required.description: Requires user passwords to contain at least one special character (()[]{}|\`~!@#$%^&*_-+=;:'",<>./?).

lowercase_character_required.title: Password must contain one lowercase letter
lowercase_character_required.description: Requires user passwords to contain at least one lowercase letter (a-z).

uppercase_character_required.title: Password must contain one uppercase letter
uppercase_character_required.description: Requires user passwords to contain at least one uppercase letter (A-Z).

default_group.description: New users will be assigned to this group.

default_group_role.description: New users will be assigned to their default group with this role.
